edu.cuny.util
Class SyncTask

java.lang.Object
  edu.cuny.util.SyncTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener
public class SyncTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventListener

A class enabling one task to wait until a certain number of events of specified type occur. The waiting may time out and the task then be triggered after a certain period. This mechanism is implemented based on Event.

Version:
$Revision: 1.18 $
Author:
Jinzhong Niu

Field Summary
protected  int count
          number of events to wait to occur.
 boolean debug
           
protected  java.lang.Object tag
          used to further distinguish between events of the same type; can be viewed as a filter so as to process only a subset of the events of the given type.
protected  int timeout
          the maximal waiting time
protected  java.lang.Object type
          the type of Event to wait to occur.
 
Constructor Summary
SyncTask(java.lang.Object type, int timeout)
          creates a synchronization task with null tag and one event being waited.
SyncTask(java.lang.Object type, java.lang.Object tag, int count, int timeout)

SyncTask

public SyncTask(java.lang.Object type,
                java.lang.Object tag,
                int count,
                int timeout)
Parameters:
type - the type of event to wait to occur
tag - only those events of the type with this tag as user object is counted
count - the number of events to wait
timeout - the period to wait before timing out
